result.execSummary:
The defendant Simon E Jeninga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------

Counseling, including Sex Offender Treatment, as recommended by the Agent.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with N.J., D.V., or M.Y.V. No contact with the victim's family. No contact with any minors without the approval of Agent.
--------------------------------
Sex Offender Registration. Must take any prescribed medications only as prescribed.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Oral Ruling before the Honorable David Reddy on April 11, 2018
Court Reporter Adrianne Adams
Letter from Atty Marion

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Colleen Marie Marion.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present in Court is Detective Tom Bushey from Elkhorn Police Department. Court in session @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for oral ruling on defendant's Post Conviction Motion for plea withdraw and suppression of evidence based upon ineffective assistance of counsel.
2:58 p.m. - Court addresses ineffective assistance of counsel and refers to Hunt under 214Wi102 as to elements. Record by Court who reads into the record transcript from Machner hearing. Court addresses state as to their position as to this issue. Response by Atty. Donohoo who responds to Court's questions. Response by the Court who refers to State's brief that stressed Colbert which states case law is not settled as to a single statement as to relationship between possession of pornography and sexual assault/molestation and why these questions were not asked. Response by ADA Donohoo - continued discussion/argument as to this issue.
3:07 p.m. - Court addresses Atty. Marion as to her position on issue of ineffective assistance of counsel/strategy. Response/argument by Atty. Marion, who also responds to Court's questions that her position is that Atty. Dietrich's decision was wrong, not strategic, which brings effectiveness below standard.
3:11 p.m. - Court turns to State for their response. Record/responds by Atty. Donohoo.
3:15 p.m. - Response by the Court. Atty. Marion responds to Court's questions regarding timing of decision. Strategic decision was done way before defendant made decision to plead. Response by Atty. Donohoo, who clarifies her argument ands responds to further questions by the Court. Response by Atty. Marion.
3:22 p.m. - Court addresses Atty. Marion as to her brief and reference to standards of public defender's office. Response. Continued argument. Atty. Donohoo suggests this matter be continued to bring Atty. Dietrich back to testify.
3:25 p.m. - Atty. Marion responds that she is not sure why more evidence is needed. Continued argument and response by the Court as to its position. Continued argument.
3:28 p.m. - ADA Donohoo requests court to rule on prejudical prong at this point and merits on probable cause, good faith. Court puts aside this issue and moves to the merits.
3:31 p.m. - Court addresses probable cause argument as to search warrant statement regarding connection between sexual assault and search of telephone based on experience of officer by Atty. Marion. Response to that argument by ADA Donohoo. Response by the Court that ADA Donohoo is arguing outside the record and that state is relying on Colbert in their brief. ADA Donohoo responds to Court's question as to whether they are still relying on this case. Response by ADA Donohoo who refers to brief filed on March 28th and does not want to limit her argument to Colbert. Response by the Court. ADA Donohoo informs the Court she has not read Colbert. 
3:38 p.m. - Court turns to Atty. Marion as to her position that Colbert is distinguishable. Response by Atty. Marion. Response by the Court who refers False and  Hodson cases that found it necessary to contrast both of these cases from Colbert and reads from case into the record as to timing of search warrant, etc. Response by ADA Donohoo who also responds to Court's questions. ADA Donohoo requests a continuance as she was not prepared to argue today as she thought she was only here for oral ruling, and was not expecting to argue today. ADA Donohoo responds to questions by the Court as to whether she read briefs, etc.. Response by ADA Donohoo. 
3:44 p.m. - Response by Atty. Marion who understands the State's position, but still objects to any adjournment for more evidence as her client deserves timely resolution to his case/motion.
3:46 p.m. - Response by the Court who addresses Atty. Marion as  another issue of prejudice prong - if motion to suppress was granted and no images were allowed in, could images come in as other acts evidence in the sexual assault case.
3:48 p.m. - Court responds ADA's Donohoo's question regarding any challenge to seizure of phone. Response/argument by Atty. Marion.
3:52 p.m. - Court responds to parties as to the number of questions regarding the other arguments raised. Court believes he would be remiss in deciding this motion based upon the record before the Court and needs more information. For those reasons, he is going to adjourn this hearing. Court orders ADA Donohoo to argue this motion and encourages parties to have Ms. Dietrich available for testimony if they deem it necessary. He will not require it. Discussion as to what is done first - evidentiary hearing or briefing. Parties agree that evidentiary hearing will come first. Court goes off the record to address scheduling.
4:03 p.m. - Court back on the record and cites adjourned motion date.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 10, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
**NOTE:  After Court parties were informed that Atty. Dietrich is not available on the date of May 10th. Matter now set for May 30, 2018 @ 2:30 p.m. before Judge Reddy.**

Motion on Postconviction Relief Before the Honorable David M. Reddy on February 6, 2018
Court Reporter: Adrianne Adams
Motion to Extend 2 12 18

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Colleen Marie Marion.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 9:55 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for defense motion for postconviction relief. Parties are ready to proceed.
9:57 a.m. - Defense calls Attorney Michelle Dietrich who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Atty. Marion.
10:02 a.m. - Cross exam by ADA Johnson
10:09 a.m. - Redirect by Atty. Marion
10:09 a.m. - Witness excused. Atty. Marion has no further witnesses, but makes a record as to stipulation for admission of exhibits that were attached to the motion. Atty. has extra copies of search warrant/application. Exhibits A & B - received with no objection. Defense has no further evidence for today.
10:11 a.m. - Record by Atty. Johnson as to search warrant and asks if the Court wishes Detective Bushey to testify to her review of search warrant. Response by Court as to offer of proof. Response by Atty. Marion to Court's question regarding testimony of this witness that wishes testimony to be taken.
10:13 a.m. - State calls Detective Thomas K. Bushey who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Johnson
10:16 a.m. - Cross by Atty. Marion. 
10:16 a.m. - Witness excused. Testimony is closed.
Court goes off the record to address argument/briefing/transcript and date for oral ruling. 
10:25 a.m.  - Back in session/on record. Court makes record of discussions. Transcript to be filed  by 3/2/18; Defense Brief due 3/14/18; State's Response due 3/28/18; Defense Reply due April 4th, and matter set for oral ruling.
Parties have nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 10:27 am  Oral ruling scheduled for April 11, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

** Transcript filed 6/6/17**  

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:58 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing hearing. Court has reviewed the pre-sentence investigation and addresses Atty. Anderson as to any additions corrections. Atty. Anderson makes a record as to their corrections/additions to the pre-sentence investigation. 
9:04 a.m. - Court addresses State as to victim notification law. State has complied with victim's rights. No victims are present to speak. No victim impact statement filed. State makes request as to restitution being held open for 60 days. Response by the Court that this was addressed at the plea hearing, and court will not grant this request pursuant to record made at that time.
9:05 a.m. - Argument by the State.
9:14 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Anderson, who has family members who would like to speak on behalf of the defendant before she proceeds. 
9:15 a.m. - Faith Jones, defendant's sister reads a statement to the Court.
9:19 a.m. - Statement read by Defendant's Mother, Elizabeth
9:21 a.m. -  Statement by Jail Chaplin on defendant's behalf
9:23 a.m. - Statement made by Gary Sisk on defendant's behalf
9:25 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Anderson
9:45 a.m. - Statement by victim's grandmother
9:48 a.m. - Defendant reads his statement to the Court
9:53 a.m. - Court in recess to reach decision.
10:17 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Record made by the Court, who goes over charges, maximum penalties, and sentencing guidelines/objectives/factors. Court pronounces sentence:

2016CF00062:
Ten (10) years Initial Confinment followed by ten (10) years of extended Supervision
393 Days of Dead Time Credit

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Pay Court Costs and Department of Supervision Fees
- Submit DNA Sample and pay surcharge.
- Must register as a sex offender
- No alochol, drugs, or drug paraphernaila
- Any prescription medications taken only as prescribed
- No contact with N.J., D.V., or M.Y.V. No contact iwt the victim's family. No contact with any minors without the approval of Agent.

Court gives defendant warnings as to firearms, voting rights, body armor, and exclusion of working/volunteering with any children under the age of 16.

Parties have nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 10:31 a.m.
2nd Amended Information

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson. Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 10:00 a.m. Appearances made. matter before the Court for plea hearing. Atty. Anderson makes a record of the agreement of the parties. ADA Johnson supplements record made by Anderson. 
10:00 a.m. - Record made by Atty. Anderson as to issues with reports received late on Friday/ thumb drive, files/images as to pornography charges, and requests that the cell phone be sent up to the crime lab for analysis for mitigation purposes at time of sentencing. Atty. Anderson responds to Court's questions.
10:08 a.m. - Response by ADA Johnson as to report/file size and other aspects of Atty. Anderson's record. Court calls Detective Lambert who responds to comments about file/image size, and other issues raised by Atty. Anderson. Response by Atty. Anderson. Continued discussion. Atty. Anderson supplements her record, and responds to Court questions regarding her expert and what his opinion was on this issue. Detective Lambert responds to Court's questions regarding State Crime Lab and their capability as to ability to analyze the cache file./thumbnail. Detective Lambert does not believe the Crime Lab would be able to provide any further information as to size of files. Response by Atty. Anderson, who then requests that she be allowed to bring in her expert at sentencing to provide information to the Court. Court grants Atty. Anderson's request and will allow her expert to testify as to files viewed at sentencing hearing. Atty. Anderson supplements her record as to her discussion/explanation of this issue with her client, who still wishes to accept the proposed agreement. 
10:19 a.m. - Response by Atty. Lambert to Court's questions. ADA Johnson responds to Court's question as to moving forward with the plea today. ADA Johnson responds that she is confident that they could prove child pornography, and is comfortable moving forward with today's hearing. Response by Atty. Anderson as to DDA Johnson's record. Court proceeds with plea hearing. Court asks if State provided jury instruction as to amended charge. Response by Atty. Johnson that she did not. Response by Atty. Anderson that she has attached the instructions to the plea questionnaires.
10:23 a.m. - State has complied with victim's rights, and both parents are present in court today. State indicates that the victim's father would like to speak at sentencing hearing. Response by Atty. Anderson.
Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Atty. Anderson believes defendant is making a free and knowing change of plea to the two counts indicated in agreement. Court finds defendant is freely and knowingly entering his guilty plea to the charges as indicated. 
Defendant pleads GUILTY TO COUNT #1 OF 2ND AMENDED INFORMATION IN FILE NUMBER 2016CF000062 AND GUILTY TO COUNT #1 IN CASE NO. 2016CF000162. ALL REMAINING COUNTS ON 2016CF000162 ARE DISMISSED AND READ IN.
Court orders PSI and sets matter over for sentencing. 
Court inquires whether there is a restitution claim. Response by ADA Johnson that she is not aware of any, but can sort it out before sentencing. Response by Atty. Anderson that she has not seen any restitution request. Court believes defendant deserves to know what he is pleading to, and orders no restitution requested in this matter. 
Court in recess @ 10:36 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 7/21/2017: COURT REPORTER RHONA BOSS**
State's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 9:03 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court to address potential resolution as well as pending other acts motion/decision. DDA Johnson informs the Court that parties are ready to proceed to trial, and files amended information correcting the charge/severity. Record made by Atty. Anderson as to penalties listed on information and subsections that apply in this case, and her objection. Response by the Court. Atty. Anderson acknowledges receipt of amended information and enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
9:08 a.m. - Court moves to other acts motion and addresses the parties as to specific other acts in State's motion. Court asks the State which document they are working off of as to other acts (in affidavit or attached spreadsheet). Response by Atty. Anderson. Response by State. Court references Detective Lambert's offer of proof and makes a record as to his understanding of what Det. Lambert is able to testify to. Court turns to Atty. Anderson for response. 
Court moves to Step Two of  Sullivan analysis as to other acts in affidavit (search terms), and if there are similarities. Argument by DDA Johnson. Court finds this is not similar enough and does not meet Sullivan. Court move to next search term - Court finds that this is not specific enough and does not meet Sullivan. Court moves to next search term - Court does not believe similar. Next search term - duplicate - not similar. Next search term - Argument by DDA Johnson. Argument by Atty. Anderson that there is no indication of any familial relationship in these search terms. Argument - Court does not find similarity. Court moves to next item - Argument by DDA Johnson as to similarity. Court finds not similar. Next search terms - Argument by DDA Johnson as to similarity. Court finds not similar. Next search term - "daddy's lap". Court believes this search term is somewhat similar and turns to Atty. Anderson as to her position on this search. Court applies greater lattitude rule to this search term and will allow this search term at trial. Next search - Argument by DDA Johnson. Response by Atty. Anderson. Court finds it meets Sullivan under greater lattitude rule. Next search - Argument by DDA Johnson. Response by Atty. Anderson - Court finds similar enough under Sullivan and under greater lattitude rule. Next search - Argument by DDA Johnson. Court will not allow. Final search - Argument by DDA Johnson. Response by Atty. Anderson. Court finds similar enough and under greater lattitude rule will allow.
Court reserves ruling on admissibility of search terms until defense of mistake is made at trial.
9:28 a.m. - Court moves to Step #3 of Sullivan  and turns to State for Argument. Response/argument by Atty. Anderson as to unfair prejudice. Response by the Court.
9:31 a.m. - Court turns to analysis of search terms as to motive and intent. Argument by Atty. Anderson as to her position regarding motive and intent exception. Atty. Anderson provides case law in support of her position to the Court. 
9:35 a.m. - Court in recess to review cases cited in Atty. Anderson's argument.
10:12 a.m. - Back in session @ 10:12 a.m. with same appearances. Court makes a record as to cases relating to other acts (motive, intent). Based upon cases cited, Court needs to determine length of time search times were to the alleged incidents. Response by Atty. Anderson that she cannot read the report, and it appears searches occurred months after alleged incidents.Response by DDA Johnson.
Court finds that all the search terms he found valid are near in time and can be used. Court moves to issue of motive, and agrees with the cases cited by Atty. Anderson. Court believes that motive is relevant in this case and moves to step three of motive and intent.
10:18 a.m. - Atty. Anderson continues her argument as to intent/motive and unfair prejudice. Court addresses Detective Lambert as to offer of proof and clarification as to whether items discussed were search times or names of actual videos. Response by Det. Lambert. Argument as to unfair prejudice/intent/motive continues by Atty. Anderson. Response by the Court. Clarification by Det. Lambert whether website is an adult or child porn site. Response by Atty. Anderson. Record by DDA Johnson that she does not believe it is relevant whether site is an adult or child, and believes this can be addressed through cross examination of Detective Lambert. Response by Atty. Anderson. 
10:29 a.m. -  Court makes a finding that items meet Sullivan and that acts go to weight and not admissibility of evidence and finds that these other acts are relevant, but will give jury cautionary instruction as to these acts.
10:31 a.m. - Court turns to final pretrial: 
Jury Instructions from State - to be filed today.
Witness lists from State - to be filed today.
Exclusion of witnesses - granted except for biological parents, Detective Bushey
Voir Dire - To be done in jury room if needed.
Publishing of images to jury in binder and not on screen
Prior convictions - discussed and will be addressed if defendant testifies
DDA Johnson makes a record as to contact/notification of victim's mother, and is compliance with victim rights.
Court addresses Atty. Anderson's Motions in Limine and grants all of requests listed (#1-#10). Only Motion in limine different in file 16CF162 relates to whether Detective Lambert will be testifying as expert witness, and her potential Daubert motion. Response by the State. Court will start the Daubert Motion as to 16CF162 @ 8:30 a.m. on Monday. Jury will report to courtroom at 9:30 a.m. for voir dire. If Daubert is not finished, it will be heard prior to Detective Lambert's testimony.
Discussion as to in custody defendant, clothing, hair cut, etc...
Parties have nothing further.
Court in recess @ 10:57 a.m.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 6/12/2017: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 4:03 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial, but parties have reached an agreement. Atty. Anderson makes a record as to the agreement of the parties. 
4:04 p.m. - DDA Johnson makes a record at Court's request as to justification for the amendment down to 4th degree sexual assault from Class B felony. Court asks why the complaint and information are incorrect and no one caught it until now. Response by DDA Johnson. Response by the Court. DDA Johnson responds to Court's questions as to these issues. Court addresses whether anyone had other issues with this potential agreement. Response by DDA Johnson. Court will not consider this agreement until the DA signs off on.  Response by DDA Johnson that DA has disqualified himself on this matter and as such she cannot speak to him on this case. Court goes over guidelines as to acceptance of plea agreement, and asks DDA Johnson if there are proof issues in this case that would adversely affect prosecution. DDA Johnson will not state that she cannot meet her burden of proof, but is concerned about what a jury would do. 
4:19 p.m. - Court turns to Atty. Anderson as to any argument she wishes to make to convince the Court to accept this agreement.  Argument/record made by Atty. Anderson.
4:27 p.m. - Court turns to DDA Johnson as to criminal complaint/original charges; lack of contact with the mother; any response to Atty. Anderson's argument. DDA Johnson responds to each question. 
Court makes a record and informs DDA Johnson that she can move to dismiss the sexual assault as to burden of proof issues, but he will not allow the State to amend the charge as requested. 
4:30 p.m. - Court in recess to allow parties to discuss Court's ruling.
4:52 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances.  DDA Johnson makes a record as to her discussion with the victim's family as to Court's question as to whether she can meet her burden of proof. DDA Johnson requests that she be given one day before giving her decision as to burden of proof issue. Response by Atty. Anderson that she would have no objection to one more day. 
4:55 p.m. - DDA Johnson responds to Court's questions. Court informs the parties that they need to address the other acts motion before Monday if case goes to trial and wants this added to tomorrow. Court sets other acts motion for 9:00 a.m. tomorrow.
4:57 p.m. - DDA Johnson makes record as to sexual offender registry issue from earlier. Atty. Anderson has nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 4:57 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 09:00 am.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 7/11/2017: COURT REPORTER EILEEN GRZENIA**
To Dismiss Criminal Information
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 11:00 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for State's Other Acts Motions. Court addresses the parties as to motion before the Court, and makes a record as to Sullivan Analysis and the issues relating to the sites referred to within the State's motion, and searches referred to in the motion.  Response by DDA Johnson who informs the Court that the sites in this new motion are not new sites. 
11:03 a.m. - Response by Atty. Anderson that there is nothing within the motion that provides a new description of the searches/websites within the criminal complaint, and states that there is no way to know what search terms were used based upon the information provided. 
11:07 a.m. - Argument regarding images reviewed, and whether they are the same images that the defendant accessed. Court inquires whether the State is trying to get in the websites or the content as well. Response by DDA Johnson that she does want to introduce the websites, searches, and would like to introduce the content, but understands the problems with proving content.  Response by the Court, who questions the State as to why these incidents were not charged. Response by DDA Johnson.
11:12 a.m. - Court addresses next step in Sullivan analysis, and makes a record as to his position
11:13 a.m. - Atty. Anderson responds to argument of the State regarding search terms used. Continued argument as to exactly which images the State is looking to get in - whether they are child or adult pornography websites. Atty. Anderson requests clarification as to "daughter search" in her affidavit. Court goes over paragraph #6 in the State's affidavit one by one and addresses text messages first. Record by the State that text messages will be used for context and not other acts. Moving to next item regarding searches, State makes a record that these too would be used for absence of mistake. Court will address at time of trial. Next item also refers to absence of mistake and will be dealt with at trial. Same for the next two (2) items. 
11:19 a.m. - Court believes these issues need to be held in abeyance until the defense strategy is known at time of trial.  Response by the State who would like a ruling on the search terms as she would like to use them in her case in chief. Court addresses these specific items and asks for clarification as to what these items are - whether search terms, websites, videos, or icons. Response by DDA Johnson. Response by Atty. Anderson. Continued discussion as to website referred to and searches within that site.
11:28 a.m. - Court makes a record as to discussion, and finds that site itself is other acts and should fall under Sullivan analysis. Court does Sullivan analysis on websites. Response by the parties. DDA Johnson responds to Court's questions regarding other video on websites. - xhamster.com. Question by Atty. Anderson if this is a link to a site or to the exact video. Response by DDA Johnson.
11:34 a.m. - Court believes that it needs more information and breakdown as to these videos/searches/sites. Response by DDA Johnson that she is not sure what more the 
11:35 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Anderson that this forensic download is of the Browser cache, and it cannot be shown whether items were in fact accessed by the individual.
11:36 a.m. - Court has detective Lambert respond to Atty. Anderson's argument and agrees that the history will show search terms, but cannot tell if the individual actually accessed the images.
11:38 a.m. - Response by Atty. Anderson
11:39 a.m. - Response by the Court who clarifies that what the State is looking for is that the defendant typed in certain websites and entered certain search terms. State agrees. Response by Atty. Anderson that argues that this motion will not meet the next step in Sullivan analysis as the majority of the sites are adult pornographic sites.
11:41 a.m. - Response by DDA Johnson. Response by the Court. Response by Atty. Anderson. Response by DDA Johnson as to Atty. Anderson's argument.
11:47 a.m. - Court addresses other sites that appear to be child pornography and asks Atty. Anderson if these would meet intent analysis. Argument by Atty. Anderson.
11:51 a.m. - Detective Lambert responds to Court's questions.
11:53 a.m. - Court instructs State to break down the items listed on bullet points and wants to know which are websites, which are from the cache, which if any of the videos were actually viewed, and whether they can say for sure. 
Response by Atty. Anderson that she believes that the forensic examination is done by downloading the cache, which puts said acts in the same spot. 
Response by the Court who asks Det. Lambert about their examination procedures. Court wants narrowed down video/searches with break down no later than December 22nd, and Court will continue the motion until the final pretrial. Parties have nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 11:59 a.m.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 6/13/2017: COURT REPORTER JANET SCHULZ**
Notice of Self-Imposed Disqualification
State's Brief in Support of Motion to Introduce Evidence
Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence
of Videotaped Statement of a Child, Offer of Proof, and Request for Hearing Sec. 908.08(2)(a) Wis. Stats.

Court in session 2:14pm
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
In court today for joinder motion.  
Statement by Atty Anderson.  
Court returns to Sullivan analysis.  
Court has already found that motive is an acceptable purpose.  
Court questions attorneys as to how the cases are similar.  
Response by ADA indicating the age of the people in them makes them similar.
Reply by Atty Anderson objecting to ages.  
Court requests clarification from ADA Johnson regarding age of people in photos.  
Response by Atty Anderson that it needs to go beyond ages for similarity.  
Court finds photo #1 is similar.  
Court will deal with the remaining images collectively.   
Statement by Det. Lambert in regards to how age of children is determined.  
Discussion between parties.  Atty Anderson sustains her standing objections.  
Court questions parties as to probitive value.  
Court finds that the child porn is admissible to show motiviation for sexual assualt and is part of common scheme, common motive.
Court grants State's request for joinder as to the 10 photos.
Pre-trial set for January 5, 2017 @ 3:30, 12 person jury trial set for January 9-13, 2017.  
Court adjourned 2:47pm

2:31 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Simon E Jeninga in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Matter is before the Court on the State's Motion for Joinder.  Attorney Anderson filed a Brief in Response.  Court indicates it has not seen the Brief.  It was entered on the Court record on May 31st.  2:34 pm  Court takes break to review a copy of Defendant's Brief in response to State's motion to join
2:38 pm  Court has now had a chance to review Atty Anderson's Response.  Court believes that doing a Sullivan analysis would be the proper way to approach the Motion.  

Step 1:  Purpose for which the other acts is to be admitted.  
Court will address this as the first case being the sexual assault and the second case being the pornography.  Court did review St vs Hurley in preparation for this hearing.  
Court makes record that it believes Motive as an acceptable purpose
Argument by Atty Anderson 
As to Step 1, the Court finds that motive is an acceptable purpose

Step 2 - Is the other acts evidence relative under Sec. 904.01?
Court reads from "Hurley" re:  probative value
Court reads portions of the criminal complaint into the record  

Court asks if the parties have seen any of the images?  
Atty Anderson has not seen any of the images.  Atty Anderson believes a ruling on this Motion might be premature before she can view the images.  
Court asks if Atty Johnson knows if the referenced sites have images which are similar to what their names imply?  
Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Atty Johnson indicates these images could be viewed at the police department.  
Court believes that counsel has to review these images before the Court can make a decision as to probative value.  
Attorney Anderson believes she's going to need to hire an expert to assist her.  
Judge Reddy proposes putting this on a 1:15 Call in approximately 45 days for status.  

2:58 pm  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
